title: A Resort-Like Compound on South Carolina’s Kiawah Island
text:
Listing of the Day

Location: Kiawah Island, South Carolina

Price: $11.6 million

A family compound on Kiawah Island, a private residential beach and golf resort off the coast of South Carolina, is for sale for $11.6 million.

Since 2013, the estate has been owned by Andrew A. Ziegler, the founder and former CEO of the money management firm Artisan Partners, and his wife, Carlene M. Ziegler.

The house was built in 2000 and was listed by Gordon Hillock of Kiawah Island Real Estate on May 24.

Mr. Hillock said the Zieglers, who extensively remodeled the house, are downsizing.

"They are horse people, and they are relocating to Florida and building their main house there," he said. Once this property is sold, they plan to buy a smaller one on Kiawah Island, he said.

"The property has a sense of privacy and serenity that you seldom get elsewhere," Mr. Hillock said. "It connects directly to the private beach, and it’s next door to the beach club, which is probably the most popular part of the Kiawah Island Club. It’s a great family home for all generations."

More: A Recently Renovated Home on an Oceanfront Estate on Kiawah Island With Walls of Windows

Stats

The 8,034-square-foot house, set on more than one acre, has three levels, six bedrooms, seven bathrooms and two half-bathrooms. The property also has a guest house and a separate full-size landscaped building site that can either be used to expand the existing estate or sold separately by the new owners.

Amenities

The estate features a garden and landscaped pond, an outdoor terrace with a music system and a saline pool and spa and dehumidified garages that can house up to seven cars and seven beach cruiser bicycles. Inside the house, there are high-tech music and lighting systems, an elevator, three kitchen/prep areas, a fireplace and a dining room with a porch outfitted with outside speakers. The games room, library and family room are appointed with stained antique pecan architectural detailing designed by an Oklahoma artisan. The master suite, which has a private outdoor porch with views of the ocean, has double closets with a safe, a stackable washer and dryer and a refrigerator.

The property also comes with membership to the Kiawah Island Club, which has two private golf courses—one designed by Tom Fazio, the other by Tom Watson, and a beach club designed by Robert A.M. Stern Architects. There are also clubhouses with ballrooms, entertaining rooms, fitness centers, red-clay tennis courts and a boathouse stocked with kayaks and stand-up paddle boards.

From Penta: David Koch’s Philanthropic Legacy

Neighborhood Notes

Kiawah Island, which is 25 miles off the coast of South Carolina, is an uber-exclusive enclave, where the beach lifestyle of its 1,600 full- and part-time residents revolves around boating, bicycling, barbecues and outdoor dining and concerts under the stars.

The island is only a half-hour drive from Charleston, which Mr. Hillock noted has been voted the No. 1 city in the world for six years in a row by Travel & Leisure magazine.

Agent: Gordon Hillock, Kiawah Island Real Estate
